page.title: 01Skirlaugh Village
page.content: Skirlaugh is a dormitory village of just over six hundred houses. It is situated about eight miles from Hull, nine miles from Beverley and eight miles from Hornsea. Although the area around Skirlaugh is intensively farmed few of the residents work in the agricultural industry, most travel to the nearby towns for work. The majority of the houses in the village have been built on an estate development in the last twenty years before which the settlement was restricted mainly to the four arms of the crossroads. Notable buildings include the Church of St. Augustine, thought to be one of the finest examples of the perpendicular style in the county, and the former workhouse, now the local council offices.
